content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Phoebe, Rachel and Monica are there. Ross walks in with a magazine in his hand.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, you’re not going to believe this. I made up a joke and sent it in to Playboy . They printed it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I didn’t know Playboy prints jokes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, they print jokes, interviews, hard-hitting journalism. It’s not just about the pictures.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That didn’t work on mom, it’s not going to work on us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Here, check it out. It’s the first one, too.
(They all laugh indifferently, except Chandler, who’s a little angry.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That is funny. It was also funny when I made it up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I made that joke up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, oh-oh, no you didn’t. I did.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, I did. I told it to Dan at work, and he said it was the funniest joke he’d ever heard.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, tell Dan, ‘Thanks.’
(Rachel is looking at the magazine and laughing.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry, I was just reading the joke below it. Man, that one is funny. (Ross grabs the magazine away from her.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica, you remember me telling you that joke, right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Seriously?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, you tell a lot of jokes!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, Chandler, it’s my joke. But, hey, if it makes you feel any better they don’t print the name, so it doesn’t really matter who gets credit, right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I guess.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, Joey, Playboy printed my joke.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, it’s my joke, it’s mine. You can call them, they’ll tell you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s my joke.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s my joke.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa. Jokes? You guys know they have naked chicks in there, right?

content.description: Joey’s apartment, Joey is sitting at the counter as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Dude, you have got to turn on Behind the Music . The band Heart is having a really tough time, and I think they may break up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Let’s go watch it at your place.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nah, Monica’s watching some cooking show. Come on, I don’t want to miss when they were skinny.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler, Chandler, y’know what we should do? You and I should go out and get some new sunglasses.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What? No, I want to watch this. (He turns on the television and the screen is completely covered in snow). Did your cable go out?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, that’s VH-1 . I gotta tell you, the music these kids listen to today … It’s like a lotta noise to me. I don’t know…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey, why is your cable out?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I uh, oh! Because, uh, I haven’t really paid the bill

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If you need money, will you please-please just let me loan you some money?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, Chandler. Look, forget about it, okay? Look, I know things have been a little tight since Janine moved out. Oh, was she hot.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa ho.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know! Yeah, but, look I can handle it. All right? Look, I can listen to the radio, huh? And Ross gave me this great book (holds up the Playboy magazine).

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, you want to see if the joke stealer will let us watch the show at his place?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Paid your phone bill?
content.parenthetical: with phone to ear, obviously hearing no dial tone

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not so much.

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica and Rachel are on the couch looking at the Playboy magazine. When they hear someone coming, Monica goes to hide it under the sofa cushions.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s only you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wh-wh-what are you doing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We are looking at a Playboy .

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I want to look too! (She runs over and sits down and checks out a picture). Yikes!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So do you think that these pictures—Are, are they trying to tell a story?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah, sure. I mean, like in the case of this young woman, she has lost her clothes, so she rides naked on the horse, she’s crying out, ‘Where are they, where are they?’

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, she’s not going to find them lying in the grass like that.
(They flip through the pages to another picture.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah. Aw, remember the days when you used to go out to the barn, lift up your shirt, and bend over?

content.speaker: Rachel and Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You see, now, I would date this girl. She’s cute, she’s outdoorsy, you know, and she knows how to build a fire. I mean, that’s got to come in handy

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I’ve got a question. If you had to pick one of us to date, who would it be?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Me neither.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know. (Pause) Me neither.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey, Chandler, and Ross are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You forget how many great songs Heart had.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know, Barracuda was the first song I learned to play on the keyboard.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, you heard it, you repeated it, so that must mean you wrote it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you guys, with this joke. I gotta say, I know I cracked up, but I’m not even sure I got it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, you didn’t get it? The doctor is a monkey.
(He and Chandler crack up.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And monkeys can’t write out prescriptions.
(He and Ross crack up again. Joey just sits there)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You are not allowed to laugh at my joke.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Your joke? Well, I think ‘the Hef’ would disagree, which is why he sent me a check for one hundred ah-dollars.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, you stole my joke, and you stole my money.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I was going to stick it in the ATM, but now I think I’ll show the sexy teller that I am a published writer.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, she is going to know that you stole the joke.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, what are you going to do, follow me down there?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I’m not going to go now anyway (he goes to sit down).

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay (he goes to sit down).
(Ross leaps out of his chair and runs out the door, with Chandler in hot pursuit.)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Here you go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, Gunther, I can’t pay for this right now because I’m not working, so I’ve had to cut down on some luxuries like uh, payin’ for stuff.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Well, if you want, you can work here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, I don’t know. Ya see, it’s just, see I was a regular on a soap opera y’know? And to go from that to this, I just… Plus, I’d have to wait on all my friends.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Okay, but the money’s good, plus you get to stare at Rachel as much as you want.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Flexible hours.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe I could be a waiter. Could I use the phone?

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s bedroom, they are in bed together.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She picked Rachel. I mean, she tried to back out of it, but it was obvious. She picked Rachel.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He took my joke, he took it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s wrong. You know what else is wrong? Phoebe picking Rachel.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know who else picked Rachel? Ross, and you know what else Ross did? He stole my joke. You know what? I’m going to get a joke journal. Y’know? And document the date and time of every single one of my jokes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s a good idea.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you know what’s a bad idea?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Picking Rachel.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right. (A noise comes from the living room.) Did you hear something?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Maybe it’s the sound of Ross climbing into my brain and stealing my thoughts.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s coming from the living room.
(They go out to investigate, and find Joey wrapped in a blanket watching their television.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I finished my book. (Chandler and Monica slowly retreat back to bed.)

content.description: [Scene, Phoebe and Rachel’s, they’re sitting together on the couch.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, you guys.

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, don’t you guys look cute. You guys make such a cute couple.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nothing, I’m just trying to recreate some of the fun that we had at my place the other day. (To Phoebe) Remember, when you picked Rachel over me? That was funny.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I guess it was kinda funny.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It wasn’t funny at all! Why would you do that? Why didn’t you pick me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine. The reason that I was leaning a little bit more toward Rachel than you is just that you’re … just … kinda high maintenance—Okay let’s go to lunch!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is completely untrue. You think I’m high maintenance? Okay, prove it. I want you to make a list and we’re going to go through it point by point!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, okay, you’re right. You’re easy-going. You’re just not as easy-going as Rachel. She’s just more flexible and-and mellow. That’s all.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, people are different.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ya, you know, Rachel … she’ll do whatever you want. Y’know, you can just walk all over her.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Wait a minute. What are you saying, that I’m a pushover? I’m not a pushover.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay, (laughing) you’re not a pushover.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my … you think I’m a pushover. Well wait, watch this, you know what? You’re not invited to lunch. What do you think of that? I think that’s pretty strong, that’s what I think. Come on, Monica, let’s go to lunch. (She leaves)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You start working on that list. (She grabs her coat and leaves, too.)
[Cut to the hallway.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I cannot believe her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know. Where do you wanna go eat?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, oh, I love that Japanese place.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sick of Japanese. We’re not going there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, wherever you wanna go is cool.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right.

content.description: Central Perk, Monica, Rachel, and Chandler are there as Ross enters and sees Gunther.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, hey, Gunther, check this out.
content.parenthetical: showing the Playboy magazine to Gunther

content.text: (Gunther looks at the joke and laughs.)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Yeah, that-that Chandler cracks me up.
(Ross begins to say something, realizes what Gunther just said, turns, and glares at Chandler. Chandler just shrugs it off.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Ross, listen, you want anything to drink, ‘cause I’m heading up there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, yeah, I’ll take a coffee. Thanks, man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure. (To Monica and Rachel) Coffee? ‘Cause I’m going up there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, thank you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You guys need anything, ‘cause I’m heading up there.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I’d love an ice water.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Just being friendly. (He gives Monica a ‘what’s wrong with you?’ look and proceeds to walk behind the counter.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, honey, I don’t think you’re supposed to go back there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nah, it’s okay. Right, Gunther? (Winks at him as if they’re in on a secret together.)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Don’t wink at me. And put on your apron.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, but I don’t see you asking any other paying customers to put on aprons.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, do you work here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Customer
content.text: Hey, waiter.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, what’s going on. What didn’t you tell us you work here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s kind of embarrassing, y’know. I mean, I was an actor and now I’m a waiter. It’s supposed to go in the other direction.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So is your apron. You’re wearing it like a cape.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I mean, the job’s easy and the money’s good, you know? I guess I’m going to be hanging out here anyway. I might as well get paid for it, right? I just feel kind of weird serving you guys.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on, Joey, I did it and it was fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, why would it be weird? Hey, Joey, can I get some coffee?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, I guess it doesn’t seem that weird.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Seriously, I-I asked you before and you still haven’t gotten it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See, now it’s weird again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think it’s great that you work here. You’re going to make a lot of money, and here’s your first tip: Don’t eat yellow snow. (He laughs, then picks up a pen, glares at Ross, and writes in his journal). Ah ha ha, 2:15, coffeehouse.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you know what? This is great. Finally, I have someone I can pass on my wisdom too. Let me tell you about a couple of things I learned while working at the coffeehouse. First of all, the customer is always right. (Joey nods.) A smile goes a long way. (Joey smiles) And if anyone is ever rude to you? Sneeze muffin.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks, Rach. Look, you guys are just terrific. Y’know? Now, how about clearing out of here so I can get some new customers. It’s all about turnover.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, seriously, can I get my coffee?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry, Ross. I’ll get it for you right now. And since I made you wait, I’ll toss in a free muffin.
(He looks at Rachel and winks, she gives him the thumbs-up sign.)

content.description: Phoebe and Rachel’s, Phoebe is sitting on the couch as Rachel and Monica enter.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe. We would like to talk to you for a second.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, maybe I am a little high maintenance. And maybe Rachel is a little bit of a pushover. But you know what we decided you are?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, we are very sorry to tell you this, but you, Phoebe, are flaky.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That true, I am flaky.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, what, you’re just, you’re just okay with being flaky?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, totally.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, then, I’m okay with being high maintenance.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, and I am okay with being a pushover.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s great. Good for you guys.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am not high maintenance!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I am not a pushover!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Who said you were?

content.speaker: Monica and Rachel
content.text: You did!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’m flaky. I’ll say anything.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is coming back from using the phone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Gunther. Can you uh, can you cover for me? I just got an audition.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: No, I’m leaving to get my hair dyed.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?! I like your natural color. Come on man, it’s a great part. Look, check it out. I’m the lead guy’s best friend and I wait for him in this bar and save his seat. Listen-listen. ‘I’m sorry, that seat’s saved.’

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: That’s the whole part?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, maybe he’s not his best friend, but …

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Okay, I’ll see you in an hour.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, man, I could totally get that part. ‘I’m sorry, that seat is taken.’

content.speaker: Patron
content.text: Oh, excuse me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no, I didn’t mean you. But, you believed me, huh?

content.speaker: Patron
content.text: I believed you were saving this seat for someone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, you’d hire me, right?

content.speaker: Patron
content.text: For what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Exactly! All right, everybody, listen up. The coffeehouse is going to be closed for about an hour.

content.speaker: Customers
content.text: Huh? What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, it’s for the kids. To keep the kids off drugs. It’s a very important issue in this month’s Playboy . I’m sure you all read about it.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler and Ross are both pouting and sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s my joke.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s my joke.

content.speaker: Ross and Chandler
content.text: It’s my joke.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, I don’t think we’re going to settle this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let’s have Monica decide.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Mon.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mon, get out here!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica! (She appears, not sure why she was summoned.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, okay. You have to help us decide whose joke this is.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why do I have to decide?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because you’re the only one that can be fair.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t be fair. You’re my boyfriend.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, but I’m your brother. We’re family. That’s the most important thing in the world.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Don’t try to sway her. (To Monica) (Softly) I’m your only chance to have a baby. Okay, let’s go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’ll each tell you how we came up with the joke and then you decide which one of us is telling the truth—me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, Chandler, you go first.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I thought of the joke two months ago at lunch with Steve.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, wait, is he the guy I met at Christmas?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can I finish my story?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you want me to pick you?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: See, I would never snap at you like that.
(Chandler motions to Monica that he’ll give her two babies.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Continue.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So Steve said he had to go to the doctor. And Steve’s doctor’s name is Doctor Muppy. So I said, ‘Doctor Monkey?’ And that is how the whole Doctor Monkey thing came up. (He slams his feet up on the table to emphasize his point.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you kidding? Okay, look. I-I studied evolution. Remember, evolution? Monkey into man? Plus, I’m a doctor, and I had a monkey. I’m Doctor Monkey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not arguing with that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, I’ve heard enough. I’ve made my decision.
(Both Chandler and Ross are eager to hear her decision.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You are both idiots. The joke is not funny, and it’s offensive to women, and doctors, and monkeys! You shouldn’t be arguing over who gets credit, you should be arguing over who gets blamed for inflicting this horrible joke upon the world! Now let it go! The joke sucks!
(Monica leaves the room)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s your joke.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is not.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is sitting at a table and Phoebe is on the couch. Chandler and Monica can be seen outside, she’s lecturing him, and pushes him inside. He then nods to Rachel, and is obviously counting off the seconds in his head and then Monica makes a grand enterance.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, Chandler. There you are.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi, oh hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, it’s Phoebe and Rachel. Um, why don’t you tell them what you were telling me earlier about me not being high maintenance?
(Rachel and Phoebe exchange looks.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica is a self-sufficient, together lady. (Pause.) Being with her has been like being on a vacation. And what may be perceived as high maintenance is merely attention to detail and—(He falters and Monica prompts him.)—generosity of spirit.
content.parenthetical: starts to recite a rehearsed speech

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow, you know what? That is the best fake speech I think I’ve ever heard.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really? I’ve heard better.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait, wait, he came up with that himself. Tell them, Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m out of words. Should I just say the whole thing again?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, I am not high maintenance. I am not. Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re a little high maintenance.
content.parenthetical: pauses as he struggles with what he has to say

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ahhh! You are on my list.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry. You’re not easy-going, but you’re passionate, and that’s good. And when you get upset about the little things, I think that I’m pretty good about making you feel better about that. And that’s good too. So, they can say that you’re high maintenance, but it’s okay, because I like … maintaining you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: (To Phoebe and Rachel) I didn’t even tell him to say that. (They hug). All right you’re off my list.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m off the list. (Sits on the couch.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, it’s okay that you don’t want me to be your girlfriend because I have the best boyfriend.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, suddenly I find you very attractive.
(Joey enters.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, buddy boy, how’d the audition go?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not good, no. I didn’t get the part, and I lost my job here, so …

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! That is a bad audition.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How-how did you lose your job here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I had the audition but Gunther said I had to stay here and be in charge so he could go get his hair dyed. So, I went anyway, and then he fired me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He left work in the middle of the day to do a personal errand and left you in charge when you’ve been working here two days? That’s not, that’s not right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, what are ya gonna do?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, you can’t let him get away with that. Ya know what, I’m not going to let him get away with that. I’m going to say something to him—No, I really shouldn’t say anything—No, I should say something to him. (Goes to the counter) Gunther, I want you to give Joey his job back. That is really not fair that you have to fire him…

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: He can have his job back.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s right, he can have his job back. I’m glad we got that all straightened out. There you go, Joey, you got your job back.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s great. Thanks Rach.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, pretty nice, huh? Now who’s a pushover?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rach, you’re in my seat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. (Gets up and moves.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are sitting at the kitchen table, talking.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, I never got to hear who you guys would pick to be your girlfriend.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I pick you, Phoebe.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah. Definitely you, Pheebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, well, I kinda thought.
(Phoebe gets up from the table, and while her back is turned, Rachel and Monica indicate via sign language that they each would have picked the other.)
(Joey, Chandler and Ross enter.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey. Oh, I have a question. If-if-if one of you had to pick one of the other two guys to go out with, who would you pick?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No way.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m not answering that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey! (Pause as they all stare at him.) No way. I’m not answering that.
